title: Principal Innovation Hub Solution Engineer, Cloud and AI
preferred_qualifications_text: : AI Solution Design Experience: Expertise in designing architectures and hands-on experience building and deploying AI. Experience with Copilot Studio, AI Foundry, Large Language Models, prompt engineering, agentic architecture, responsible AI practices and familiarity with emerging industry standards such as MCP and A2A. Understanding of AI - related Azure services such as Cognitive Services and more. Certification in relevant technologies or disciplines Azure Certifications: AI-102 Azure AI Engineer Associate or AZ-305 Azure Solutions Architect Expert or DP-600 Fabric Analytics Engineer Associate or DP-700 Fabric Data Engineer Associate or AZ-204 Azure Developer Associate or other domain-relevant certifications from different vendors Design Thinking: Proven experience of delivering design thinking; ‘ ideation ’; or similar context analysis / problem framing. AI and Application Design Expert : E xtensive, hands-on experience on developing API s using microservices and modern application development techniques. Experience with SDLC leveraging Azure DevOps, GitHub Enterprise, or similar tools. Architectural experience of guiding enterprise customers on developing modern applications with AI technologies. Adept at solution design, development, integration, governance, compliance, and security, this role drives operational excellence and responsible AI transformation through scalable, secure, and sustainable solutions. Enterprise Architect Experience: Proven experience as an Enterprise Architect, designing and implementing large-scale, complex solutions that align with business goals and technical requirements. Ability to integrate various technologies and platforms to create cohesive and scalable architectures. Experience with cloud and hybrid infrastructures, adjacent technologies, architecture designs, migrations, and industry standards. Strategic & Structured Facilitator: Validated customer experience in requirements capture; prioritization; capturing evidence and impact to quantify business value; issue, risk and constraint identification with a focus on strategic goals and outcomes. Use of consultative selling skills to navigate complex technical landscapes, establish trust and deliver tailored solutions that meet specific customer needs. Solution Engineering IC5 - The

title: Research Intern - Artificial Intelligence
required_qualifications_text: Currently enrolled in a Master or PhD program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or a related field.
preferred_qualifications_text: Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and vibrant research environment. Willingness to embrace knowledge outside your field of research interest. Solid programming skill in Python, PyTorch and experience conducting experiments and writing papers. Familiarity with current various world modeling methods. Experience in LLM, either pre-train or post-train. Experience in RL, Computer Vision or Signal Processing is a plus. Relevant publications such as CVPR, ACL, ICML, ICCV, ECCV, NeurIPS, ICLR, EMNLP etc. Applied Sciences IC2 :
other_requirements_text: Research Interns are expected to be physically located in their manager’s Microsoft worksite location for the duration of their internship. In addition to the qualifications below, you’ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position as well as a cover letter and any relevant work or research samples. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.
